newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore bunkers stable, suppliers sidelined.
newsitem.headline: Singapore bunkers stable, suppliers sidelined.

text.p: Low bids kept Singapore bunker suppliers sidelined on Tuesday and recent berth congestion, which tightens supplies slightly, failed to boost prices due to poor demand, traders said.

Some shipowners asked for as low as $93 per tonne for the 380-cst grade. "It is impossible to sell at that level," said one supplier. Majors quoted the 380-cst grade at around $96/$98 per tonne. "But even at $96, it's not easy to sell," said one trader.
MDO and gas oil were quoted around $188 and $198 respectively. -- Singapore Newsroom (65 8703571)
